channel.title: Principles on Systology
channel.description: Recent content in Principles on Systology

item.title: Algorithms & Performance
item.description: Principles for clear algorithms and performance engineering: micro-benchmarks, memory discipline, and deterministic generators.

item.title: Compiler Design
item.description: Guidelines for compiler design: clear IR boundaries, deterministic semantics, robust error reporting, and incremental compilation.

item.title: Data Pipelines
item.description: Principles for reliable batch and streaming pipelines: time semantics, fault tolerance, partitioning, observability, and reproducibility.

item.title: Extensibility & Plugin Architecture
item.description: Guidelines for plugin architectures, stable APIs, cross-language bindings, and safe extension points.

item.title: Intervals & Constraints
item.description: Balancing Latency (Completeness) against Verification (Integrity) by choosing between Speculative and Pessimistic intervals.

item.title: Media Analysis
item.description: Best practices for media feature extraction: stable schemas, streaming vs. batch modes, metadata preservation, and performance engineering.

item.title: Migration & Deduplication
item.description: Practices for safe, idempotent, and efficient large-scale data migration and deduplication.

item.title: ML Experiments
item.description: Practical guidance for reproducible, resource-aware ML experiments with lightweight MLOps and deterministic evaluation.

item.title: Monitoring & Observability
item.description: Best practices for metrics, structured logging, tracing, alerting, and SLO-driven reliability.

item.title: Networking & Services
item.description: Practical guidance for API design, retries/backoff, rate limiting, connection pooling, and service resilience.

item.title: Privacy & Agents
item.description: Privacy-first design rules for agents: local-first defaults, data minimization, consent, and auditable actions.

item.title: Retrieval & RAG
item.description: Core principles for robust retrieval and RAG: hybrid retrieval, embedding stability, evaluation, and privacy-aware indexing.

item.title: SQL vs. NoSQL
item.description: A framework for deciding between SQL (relational, ACID) and NoSQL (distributed, flexible schema) databases based on data structure, scalability needs, and consistency requirements.

item.title: Web App
item.description: Guiding principles for production-ready web apps (12-factor-inspired): scaling, static/media handling, background work, CI/CD, and observability.
